attributes.action: Option to offer online classes for students
attributes.additional_details: For international students, especially Chinese students, if they are infected with covid-19, they will face difficulties in returning to their home country. In particular, Chinese students who are in their final year of study in the UK may be trapped in the UK and unable to return to China if infected.
attributes.background: Most universities will now be fully offline classes for the new term starting in January, but because of the rampant spread of Omicron, it is hoped that universities will offer both online and offline options for students.

rejection.details:
Decisions on whether to deliver teaching online or in-person are matters for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament. This means that the Government is not directly responsible for the action this petition calls for.

You might like to sign this petition which calls for a related action: 

'Extend the COVID-19 temporary visa concessions for international students': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601819
